comments_since_last_sample.body: A gun you could have a look at is the redeemer from dead by daylight aka the death slingers gun

"Perhaps converted to full auto." The Tec-9 was more or less designed to be converted at home. The ATF always frowns on open-bolt designs so they made it fire from closed. I don't know the specific process to convert one but I'm sure you'd be banned for discussing it.

I see some of these comments mention the hip fire method may bring about the sideways twist, while I don't know the game yet, I think it might have to deal with overall accuracy? Sort of an accuracy check to make sure you know you cannot physically fire these guns for 30-45 minutes straight without damaging your shoulder extremely so the 'actor' or character is repositioning the gun to the hip or other should to spread wear. On average in dead 4 life your firing thousands of rounds for about an hour without any physical support. So maybe they added this as a hidden mechanic to shift unseen damage points to your personal body.
